title: Custodial beating of civilian
facts: Police officers assaulted a civilian inside the station after he was brought for enquiry, without recording any formal arrest.
decision_summary: Court held the police liable for custodial violence and ordered monetary compensation along with departmental enquiry against the officers.

title: Threatening shopkeeper with false case
facts: A police constable threatened a shopkeeper that he would register a false theft case if free goods were not given.
decision_summary: Court found misuse of authority and directed departmental action and warned against using criminal law for personal gain.

title: Illegal roadside beating during vehicle check
facts: During a vehicle check, police hit a motorcyclist with a lathi for questioning the fine amount in front of the public.
decision_summary: Court termed the act as disproportionate use of force and directed compensation and sensitisation training for the officers.

title: Threat to withdraw complaint
facts: Complainant alleged that the local Sub-Inspector repeatedly visited his house and forced him to withdraw an earlier complaint against another officer.
decision_summary: Court accepted the intimidation claim and transferred the case to another district for fair investigation, directing no contact by the accused officers.

title: Beating during illegal detention
facts: A person was picked up without any FIR and was kept overnight in the station, where he was beaten and not allowed to contact family or lawyer.
decision_summary: Court held the detention illegal, ordered compensation, and asked the State to issue guidelines on arrest and detention.

title: Threat of foisting NDPS case
facts: A police officer allegedly threatened a youth that he would be booked under NDPS Act if he did not pay money.
decision_summary: Court considered the allegation serious, ordered preliminary enquiry by senior officer and warned that NDPS provisions cannot be used as a tool of harassment.

title: Lathi charge on peaceful protest
facts: Police used lathi charge on a small group of protestors who were sitting peacefully without blocking traffic, leading to injuries.
decision_summary: Court held that use of force was excessive and directed the State to frame guidelines on use of force during protests and to compensate injured protestors.

title: Phone call intimidation for compromise
facts: A complainant received repeated late-night calls from a police officer asking him to settle a complaint privately and not pursue the case.
decision_summary: Court noted that police must remain neutral and directed a written warning and transfer of the officer, stressing that such calls shake public confidence.

title: Slapping during routine inquiry
facts: A citizen was slapped by an officer during a simple enquiry at the station when he hesitated to answer a question.
decision_summary: Court held that even a single slap by a public officer in custody settings is a violation of dignity and awarded token compensation and costs.

title: Use of rank to silence complaint
facts: A senior officer called the complainant to his chamber and used his rank and position to pressure the complainant into signing a letter stating he had no grievance.
decision_summary: Court held that such conduct amounts to intimidation and directed departmental proceedings and instructions that complaints must be recorded without pressure.
